comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Juicy_D on August 26, 2022, 08:48:31 PM<...>Just to point out that the bounty campaign guide linked further above is partial, and focuses on what are generally known as bounty hunting tasks. Those kind of tasks basically consist of spamming the hell out of your contacts, or if you’ve made an alternate set of social accounts, spamming the hell out of accounts that, in turn, are created just to spam the hell out of whomever they can. Whilst many of us may have been there at some point, even for a brief encounter to test the waters, people that have the capability of engaging in conversations on the forum will rather go for signature campaigns (when and if their account reaches certain ranks generally required). Now this is quite different in nature from the former depicted in the first paragraph, and not all campaigns offer signature bearing in their campaign. Some of the more aspirational signature campaigns are traced on this thread, though they do require generally a mid-to-high rank amongst their requirements for postulants to their campaigns. Nevertheless, there are some altcoin campaigns that seek lower ranked members as participants. In order to bear a signature, you’d need to become a Jr. Member first (>=1 Merits; >=30 Activity), and the idea is to participate in the conversations on the forum whilst avoiding spamming (big difference with what tends to happen with the social media tasks).A good starting point to understanding signature campaigns would be this other thread, where I’d read through the OP, the included links to other threads, and the rest of the posts in the threads.

comments.body: Quote from: Juicy_D on August 26, 2022, 08:48:31 PMI want to know how Bitcointalk forum works, in terms of merit, joining a campaign, rules and regulation.There are tons of beginner's guide in this forum. Utilize the search bar and put all of your queries and questions as this had been asked several times already.For your convenience, this forum operates as the biggest cryptocurrency repository of knowledge. Tons of people are active daily and there are rules that must be followed in order to avoid getting banned. If you want to rank up your account, the merit system must be completely understood so you could start earning them, but this is easier than it sounds.If your aim in this forum is to earn (which I do not think is not that of a problem), then your journey would be full of disappointments especially if you are too focused on merit earning while disregarding its primary purpose; which is to learn from this forum.
